title: How to Make Fish Sticks

steps.headline: Cut the fish into strips, as shown above.
Take out 2 bowls and a plate.
Put the egg and milk in the first bowl, and whisk it with a fork.
In the other bowl, pour in some cornmeal mix.
Dip the fish in the egg and then into the cornmeal.
steps.description: Repeat this until all the strips are breaded. Place them on the plate. afterwards.

steps.headline: Heat a cup of olive oil.
steps.description: Fish sticks are fried, so the heat should be quite high. Once the oil starts bubbling and popping, it should be hot enough. If the oil starts smoking, turn it down.

steps.headline: Put the breaded sticks in the oil until the fish is thoroughly cooked.
Get another plate out and cover it in a paper towel.
Use tongs to pick up the fish and put it on the plate.
steps.description: The ranch, honey mustard, BBQ sauce and ketchup can be used as dip.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400 F degrees.
In a large bowl, stir tartar sauce, yogurt and salt.
Spread breadcrumbs on a large plate.
Cut fish fillets crosswise into sticks.
Coat fish fillets.
steps.description: First, gently stir them in half of the yogurt mixture (separate the mixture into another bowl for this). Then, coat them with breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Place the fish fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until solid white and not clear in the center, about 15 minutes.
Transfer the fish fillets to individual or single plate(s),
Use the remaining yogurt mixture as a dip.

text: Variation 1 Cut the fish into strips, as shown above.  Take out 2 bowls and a plate.  Put the egg and milk in the first bowl, and whisk it with a fork.  In the other bowl, pour in some cornmeal mix. Flour is a good substitute. Dip the fish in the egg and then into the cornmeal. Repeat this until all the strips are breaded. Place them on the plate. afterwards. Heat a cup of olive oil. Fish sticks are fried, so the heat should be quite high. Once the oil starts bubbling and popping, it should be hot enough. If the oil starts smoking, turn it down. Put the breaded sticks in the oil until the fish is thoroughly cooked.  Get another plate out and cover it in a paper towel.  Use tongs to pick up the fish and put it on the plate. The ranch, honey mustard, BBQ sauce and ketchup can be used as dip. Variation 2 Preheat the oven to 400 F degrees. Lightly grease a baking sheet. In a large bowl, stir tartar sauce, yogurt and salt.  Spread breadcrumbs on a large plate.  Cut fish fillets crosswise into sticks.  Coat fish fillets. First, gently stir them in half of the yogurt mixture (separate the mixture into another bowl for this). Then, coat them with breadcrumbs. Place the fish fillets on the prepared baking sheet.  Bake until solid white and not clear in the center, about 15 minutes.  Transfer the fish fillets to individual or single plate(s),  Use the remaining yogurt mixture as a dip.
